meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by phoresis.
meanings.sent1: The phoretic process helps organisms move from one place to another.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the phoretic behavior of the insects.
meanings.sent3: The phoretic relationship between the two species was quite fascinating.
meanings.sent4: Her phoretic nature allowed her to adapt quickly to new environments.
meanings.sent5: The phoretic mechanism was crucial for the survival of the tiny organism.

meanings.sent1: The phoretic experiment yielded interesting results.
meanings.sent2: The phoretic theory explained the movement of particles in the solution.
meanings.sent3: The phoretic concept was difficult to grasp at first.
meanings.sent4: His phoretic approach to problem-solving was innovative.
meanings.sent5: The phoretic process was essential for the success of the project.

meanings.sent1: The phoretic substance facilitated the transportation of nutrients.
meanings.sent2: The phoretic agent enhanced the efficiency of the reaction.
meanings.sent3: The phoretic compound worked wonders in the experiment.
meanings.sent4: Her phoretic behavior in the group project was commendable.
meanings.sent5: The phoretic mechanism operated smoothly under the right conditions.
